intro: Habranthus datensis, commonly known as the Datensea lily, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of Socotra. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
